metadata.title: System and Organization Controls 2
metadata.remarks: SOC 2 is the prevailing compliance standard for technology service providers, SaaS platforms, and cloud-native organizations. Developed by the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (AICPA), it evaluates an organization's information systems against the Trust Services Criteria (TSC). Unlike prescriptive frameworks, SOC 2 is principles-based - it evaluates whether controls effectively protect systems, giving flexibility to design controls that fit operational maturity.

controls.title: COSO Principle 1: Integrity and Ethical Values

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity demonstrates a commitment to integrity and ethical values through the development of a code of conduct, communication of expected standards, and enforcement of compliance.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Establish and communicate a code of conduct. Implement whistleblower channels. Require annual ethics training for all employees.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Code of conduct document; Training completion records; Ethics hotline reports

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The board of directors demonstrates independence from management and exercises oversight of the development and performance of internal controls.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Document board oversight activities. Maintain meeting minutes showing security governance discussions.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Board meeting minutes; Governance charter; Independent director documentation

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Management establishes, with board oversight, structures, reporting lines, and appropriate authorities and responsibilities in the pursuit of objectives.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Define organizational chart with security reporting lines. Assign CISO or equivalent role with clear authority.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Org chart; Role descriptions; RACI matrix for security

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity demonstrates a commitment to attract, develop, and retain competent individuals in alignment with objectives.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Implement security awareness training programs. Include security competence in job descriptions and performance evaluations.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Training records; Job descriptions; Performance review templates

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity holds individuals accountable for their internal control responsibilities in the pursuit of objectives.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Assign control owners for each security domain. Track control effectiveness with documented accountability measures.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Control ownership matrix; Accountability policy; Disciplinary records

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity obtains or generates and uses relevant, quality information to support the functioning of internal controls.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Implement a centralized GRC platform to aggregate control status. Ensure data quality through validation and reconciliation.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: GRC platform screenshots; Data validation procedures

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity internally communicates information, including objectives and responsibilities for internal control, necessary to support the functioning of internal control.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Distribute security policies to all employees. Conduct regular security awareness communications. Maintain an internal security wiki.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Policy distribution receipts; Security newsletter archives; Intranet security page

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity communicates with external parties regarding matters affecting the functioning of internal control.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Maintain a public security page. Establish vulnerability disclosure and incident notification processes. Publish SOC 2 report summaries to customers.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Security page URL; Vulnerability disclosure policy; Customer notification templates

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity specifies objectives with sufficient clarity to enable the identification and assessment of risks relating to objectives.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Document risk appetite statement. Define security objectives aligned with business goals. Establish risk assessment methodology.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Risk appetite statement; Security objectives document; Risk framework documentation

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity identifies risks to the achievement of its objectives across the entity and analyzes risks as a basis for determining how the risks should be managed.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Conduct annual risk assessments. Maintain a risk register. Perform threat modeling for new features and infrastructure changes.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Risk register; Risk assessment reports; Threat modeling artifacts

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity considers the potential for fraud in assessing risks to the achievement of objectives.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Include fraud risk scenarios in risk assessments. Monitor for anomalous access patterns and financial transactions.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Fraud risk assessment; Anomaly detection configurations

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity identifies and assesses changes that could significantly impact the system of internal control.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Implement change management processes that include security impact assessments. Require security review for infrastructure and application changes.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Change management records; Security review approvals; Impact assessment forms

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity selects, develops, and performs ongoing and/or separate evaluations to ascertain whether the components of internal control are present and functioning.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Deploy automated compliance monitoring tools. Conduct periodic internal audits. Track control effectiveness through dashboards.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Monitoring tool configurations; Internal audit reports; Control effectiveness dashboards

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity evaluates and communicates internal control deficiencies in a timely manner to those parties responsible for taking corrective action.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Establish exception reporting and remediation tracking processes. Communicate deficiencies to control owners and management within defined SLAs.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Exception reports; Remediation tracking tickets; Management communication records

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity selects and develops control activities that contribute to the mitigation of risks to the achievement of objectives to acceptable levels.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Design controls based on risk assessment results. Document control objectives and testing procedures. Map controls to specific risks.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Control design documentation; Risk-to-control mapping; Control testing procedures

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity also selects and develops general control activities over technology to support the achievement of objectives.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Implement IT general controls including access management, change management, and operations controls across all production systems.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: ITGC documentation; Access review reports; Change management logs

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity deploys control activities through policies that establish what is expected and procedures that put policies into action.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Maintain a comprehensive policy library. Version control all policies using Git. Require annual review and update. Track employee acknowledgment.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Policy library; Version history; Acknowledgment records; Annual review dates

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity implements logical access security software, infrastructure, and architectures over protected information assets to protect them from security events.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Implement role-based access control (RBAC). Enforce MFA for all production systems. Use SSO where possible. Conduct quarterly access reviews.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Access control lists; MFA configuration; User provisioning logs; Access review reports

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Prior to issuing system credentials and granting system access, the entity registers and authorizes new users whose access is restricted to authorized personnel.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Implement formal user provisioning and deprovisioning workflows. Require manager approval for access requests. Auto-deprovision on termination.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Provisioning workflow logs; Approval records; Deprovisioning evidence

links.text: hipaa: Access Control - Unique User ID

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity authorizes, modifies, or removes access to data, software, functions, and other protected information assets based on roles, responsibilities, or the system design.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Implement least-privilege access controls. Use RBAC with predefined roles. Conduct quarterly entitlement reviews. Remove excessive permissions.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: RBAC configuration; Role definitions; Quarterly access review reports

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity implements logical access security measures to protect against threats from sources outside its system boundaries.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Deploy firewalls, WAFs, and intrusion detection/prevention systems. Segment networks. Manage ingress and egress points.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Firewall rules; Network architecture diagrams; IDS/IPS configurations

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity restricts the transmission, movement, and removal of information to authorized internal and external users and processes.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Enforce TLS 1.2+ for all data in transit. Implement DLP controls. Restrict USB and removable media. Monitor data exfiltration.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: TLS configuration; DLP policy; Data transfer logs

links.text: hipaa: Transmission Security - Encryption in Transit

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity implements controls to prevent or detect and act upon the introduction of unauthorized or malicious software.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Deploy endpoint protection on all workstations. Implement application whitelisting. Scan dependencies for known vulnerabilities.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Endpoint protection deployment status; Application whitelist; Dependency scan reports

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: To meet its objectives, the entity uses detection and monitoring procedures to identify anomalies that are indicative of security events.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Implement SIEM or centralized log management. Define detection rules for critical events. Monitor for unauthorized access attempts.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: SIEM configuration; Detection rule library; Alert notification configurations

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity monitors system components and the operation of those components for anomalies indicative of malicious acts, natural disasters, and errors.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Enable comprehensive application and infrastructure logging. Use automated alerts for critical thresholds. Implement 24/7 monitoring for production systems.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Monitoring dashboards; Alert configurations; On-call schedules

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity evaluates identified security events to determine whether controls have been compromised and whether incident response is required.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Define incident severity classification. Implement triage procedures. Document evaluation criteria. Escalate based on severity.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Incident classification matrix; Triage procedures; Incident evaluation logs

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity responds to identified security incidents by executing a defined incident response program to understand, contain, remediate, and communicate security incidents.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Develop and test incident response plan. Define communication protocols. Conduct tabletop exercises annually. Integrate with breach notification requirements.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Incident response plan; Tabletop exercise reports; Post-incident reviews; Communication logs

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity identifies, develops, and implements activities to recover from identified security incidents.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Define recovery procedures. Maintain backup and restoration capabilities. Test disaster recovery plans. Document lessons learned.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Recovery procedures; Backup test results; DR test reports; Lessons learned documentation

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity authorizes, designs, develops or acquires, configures, documents, tests, approves, and implements changes to infrastructure, data, software, and procedures.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Implement formal change management with approval workflows. Require peer review for all code changes. Maintain change logs. Track emergency changes separately.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Change management policy; PR/MR approval records; Change logs; Emergency change records

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity identifies, selects, and develops risk mitigation activities for risks arising from potential business disruptions.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Implement business continuity plans. Maintain insurance for cyber risks. Define risk acceptance criteria. Track risk treatment plans.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Business continuity plan; Risk treatment plans; Insurance documentation

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity assesses and manages risks associated with vendors and business partners.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Maintain a vendor inventory. Assess vendor security posture. Require SOC 2 or ISO 27001 from critical vendors. Review vendor risk annually.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Vendor inventory; Vendor risk assessments; Vendor SOC reports; Contract security requirements

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity maintains, monitors, and evaluates current processing capacity and use of system components to manage capacity demand.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Implement auto-scaling. Monitor resource utilization. Set capacity thresholds and alerts. Plan for peak demand.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Capacity planning documentation; Auto-scaling configurations; Resource utilization reports

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity authorizes, designs, develops or acquires, implements, operates, approves, maintains, and monitors environmental protections to meet availability commitments.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Implement disaster recovery plans. Deploy across multiple availability zones. Test backup restoration regularly. Define and meet RTO/RPO targets.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: DR plan; Backup test results; Multi-AZ deployment evidence; RTO/RPO documentation

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity tests recovery plan procedures supporting system recovery to meet its objectives.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Conduct annual DR drills. Test backup restoration. Document test results and remediate gaps. Simulate failover scenarios.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: DR drill reports; Backup restoration test results; Failover test documentation

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity implements policies and procedures over system processing to ensure processing is complete, valid, accurate, timely, and authorized.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Implement input validation. Use checksums and reconciliation for data processing. Log all data transformations. Implement idempotency for critical operations.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Input validation rules; Reconciliation reports; Processing logs

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity implements policies and procedures to detect processing errors and take corrective action to ensure data integrity.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Implement error handling and retry mechanisms. Alert on processing failures. Maintain error logs with root cause analysis.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Error handling procedures; Error log samples; Corrective action records

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity implements policies and procedures over system inputs to ensure inputs are processed completely and accurately and outputs are distributed only to intended recipients.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Validate all API inputs. Sanitize outputs. Restrict data distribution to authorized recipients. Implement data flow controls.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Input validation configurations; Output distribution controls; Data flow diagrams

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity identifies and maintains confidential information to meet the entity's objectives related to confidentiality.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Implement data classification scheme (Public, Internal, Confidential, Restricted). Label and tag data accordingly. Train employees on classification.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Data classification policy; Classification labels in use; Training records

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity disposes of confidential information to meet the entity's objectives related to confidentiality.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Define data retention schedules. Implement automated data purging. Securely wipe storage media. Document disposal procedures.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Data retention policy; Disposal records; Media sanitization certificates

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity provides notice to data subjects about its privacy practices and obtains consent, where required.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Publish clear privacy policy. Implement consent management. Provide opt-out mechanisms. Document lawful basis for processing.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Privacy policy; Consent management platform; Opt-out mechanism documentation

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity implements a process for data subjects to request access to, modification of, or deletion of their personal information.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Build DSAR workflow. Respond within regulatory timeframes (30 days GDPR). Automate data export and deletion where possible.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: DSAR procedures; Response logs; Deletion confirmation records

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The entity collects only the personal information necessary and maintains the quality of personal data.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Audit data collection points. Remove unnecessary data fields. Validate data accuracy. Implement data quality checks.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Data inventory; Collection point audit; Data minimization review
